AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS provided mostly generic troubleshooting and KB-link guidance, and then followed up with more KB-based guidance even after the customer explicitly stated the suggested steps were already completed and did not help. This indicates repetitive, low-progress AI troubleshooting rather than adapting to the customer’s confirmed context.
evidence: ATLAS (public): "This issue usually indicates that one of the antivirus engines failed to load properly or is unable to update. ... The following steps are recommended: * Ensure that temporary folders ... * Add firewall exclusions ... * If the problem persists, temporarily disable the Virus Scanning Engines one by one ..."
ADN Support (public): "Please note that all the suggested steps have already been completed. Unfortunately, these actions did not resolve the issue, the problem still persists."
ATLAS (public): "Relevant Findings from Knowledge Base and Analysis: * Article references confirm that “Failed [VSE]” errors result when an antivirus engine within MailEssentials fails to load..."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: There is no strong indication the customer was blocked from reaching a human or stuck in an AI-only loop after requesting a human. The thread includes multiple non-AI named agents responding publicly (e.g., Aditi, Arafat, Raymond, Pablo).
evidence: Aditi Garg (public): "Our Engineering team has identified the issue... Temporary Workaround... Permanent Resolution..."
Pablo Ambram (public): "Thanks for the logs and the steps recording. From our review: Mail flow and scanning appear OK..."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: While the customer stated earlier steps were already completed, later requests (e.g., fresh reproduction details, specific file versions, event logs) appear to be new or more specific asks rather than the exact same information being re-requested. No strong customer-facing evidence shows support explicitly forcing repetition of already-provided items.
evidence: ADN Support (public): "Please note that all the suggested steps have already been completed."

Pablo Ambram (public): "Could you please share the following after reproducing the UI error once more? ... Export Application.evtx ... File version and 'Date modified' for... Fresh logs (zip after one reproduction)..."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: No customer-facing statements indicate they were waiting days without response, and the visible customer-to-staff reply gaps do not clearly meet the defined multi-day thresholds based on the provided timeline.
evidence: Aditi Garg (public, 2025-10-12): "Our Engineering team has identified the issue..."
Arafat Bakhsh (public, 2025-10-18): "Our Development Team has released a new version with the fix for the current issue."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: Although multiple messages include an auto-closure warning (“ticket will stay open for one week unless...”), the text does not show the ticket actually being closed/auto-closed while the issue remained unresolved.
evidence: Aditi Garg (public): "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."
Pablo Ambram (public): "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: While the customer indicates loss of email protection and escalates, support involved engineering, provided a workaround, released a fix build, and acknowledged escalation/priority adjustment. This does not match the pattern of treating a critical issue purely as generic low-level troubleshooting without escalation.
evidence: Aditi Garg (public): "Our Engineering team has identified the issue... Temporary Workaround... Permanent Resolution..."
Raymond Guirguis (public): "Your escalation has been acknowledged, and the ticket's priority has been adjusted to ensure a more expedited response from our team."
